newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate, baht steady in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate, baht steady in late trade.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate was steady at 7.25-7.50 percent late, unchanged from rates traded early today, dealers said.
The interbank rate was at 7.00 percent late on Friday.
"The market was quiet today. There is an indication that the interbank rate will be higher tomorrow," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
Dealers said some banks began to borrow funds to meet the next round of central bank reserve requirements due on September 7 while interbank rates remained relatively low.
The baht was steady at 25.285-25.290 in late trade compared with 25.287-25.290 earlier, dealers said.
"The dollar/baht trade was in a narrow range today. The closure of Hong Kong and London markets made trading quiet in the afternoon," said one currency dealer.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium rose to 7.00/8.00 satangs per dollar from 6.50/7.00 earlier and 6.20/6.70 late on Friday.
The mid-rate was fixed at 25.28 to the dollar against 25.31 on Friday.
